poem:
The Price of Freedom  

In a dusty cell,  
Goli counts nights like coins,  
each one heavy with silence.  
Outside, the world eyes her  
through the bars of currency.  
Eighty thousand pounds,  
a foreign weight,  
for love's defense,  
for life's second chance.  
But all she holds  
is the quiet hope  
of a sky without cages.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Child bride faces execution in Iran unless she pays £80,000 in ‘blood money’ A child bride faces execution in Iran for the killing of her abusive husband unless she can raise 10bn tomans (about £80,000) to pay off the victim’s family by a December deadline. Goli Kouhkan, 25, has been on death row in Gorgan central prison in northern Iran for the past seven years. She was 18 when she was arrested over the death". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
